node.title: France-U.K. Acrimony Over Channel Crossings Deepens
node.alt: Migrants on the beach on the southeast coast of England after being rescued earlier this week.
node.description: The French responded angrily to Boris Johnsonâ€™s suggestion that France take back migrants who reach Britain, and rescinded an invitation for a top British official to discuss the crisis.
node.content: ["PARIS \u2014 French officials lashed out at Britain on Friday over a letter from Prime Minister Boris Johnson advising France to take back migrants who reach British shores, escalating a diplomatic spat just days after 27 people died trying to cross the English Channel.", "The French denounced Mr. Johnson\u2019s statement in blunt terms, calling it unacceptable, and disinvited Britain\u2019s home secretary, Priti Patel, from a crucial meeting on the migrant crisis on Sunday.", "The dispute, in the immediate aftermath of one of the deadliest disasters ever in the English Channel, underscored the diplomatic hurdles the two countries face in addressing the problem, as lingering tension over Brexit and disagreements on issues including trade and fishing rights continue to roil their relationship.", "In a letter sent to President Emmanuel Macron of France on Thursday night, Mr. Johnson wrote that France and Britain should \u201cput in place a bilateral readmissions agreement to allow all illegal migrants who cross the Channel to be returned,\u201d suggesting that if France took back migrants it would be a major step toward fixing the problem.", "The letter prompted a fierce reaction from Gabriel Attal, a French government spokesman, who said the letter was \u201cboth poor in content and completely inappropriate in its form.\u201d", "\u201cEnough with the doublespeak, enough with the constant externalization of problems,\u201d Mr. Attal, visibly irritated, told BFMTV on Friday morning. \u201cIt makes you wonder if Boris Johnson doesn\u2019t regret having left Europe, because every time he has a problem, he thinks that Europe should handle it.\u201d", "G\u00e9rald Darmanin, France\u2019s interior minister, quickly announced that Ms. Patel was no longer invited to an emergency meeting that France will hold in Calais on Sunday with ministers in charge of immigration from neighboring countries like Belgium and Germany.", "Mr. Macron said on Friday that the crisis required \u201cserious\u201d cooperation \u2014 but that Mr. Johnson\u2019s letter was not a serious effort.", "\u201cYou don\u2019t communicate from one leader to another on these issues by tweets and by letters that you make public, we aren\u2019t whistleblowers, come on,\u201d Mr. Macron said at a news conference in Rome, where he was on an official visit.", "On Wednesday, about 30 migrants crammed onto a flimsy inflatable vessel were shipwrecked in the English Channel\u2019s frigid waters, and most of them \u2014 men, women and children \u2014 drowned. French prosecutors have opened an investigation to determine the exact circumstances of the disaster, and the identities and nationalities of most of the victims have not been confirmed.", "The number of migrants setting off into the sea has soared in recent months because France has cracked down on other routes to England, especially by ferry or by truck and train through the tunnel under the Channel. So far this year, there have been 47,000 attempts to cross the Channel, and 7,800 migrants had been saved from shipwrecks, according to French officials.", "On Twitter, where he also published the full letter to Mr. Macron, Mr. Johnson wrote that \u201can agreement with France to take back migrants who cross the Channel through this dangerous route would have an immediate and significant impact.\u201d", "\u201cIf those who reach this country were swiftly returned, the incentive for people to put their lives in the hands of traffickers would be significantly reduced,\u201d Mr. Johnson said. He called it \u201cthe single biggest step\u201d the two countries could take to address the issue.", "In his letter, Mr. Johnson noted that countries like Russia and Belarus already have readmission agreements with the European Union and that any bilateral agreement between France and Britain would be temporary, pending a broader deal between the E.U. and Britain.", "He also outlined other proposals, including better intelligence sharing, joint police patrols on French shores \u2014 which France has already rejected \u2014 and reciprocal maritime patrols in each country\u2019s territorial waters.", "But French officials reacted furiously on Friday morning to the suggestion that France should take back migrants, calling the idea a nonstarter and accusing Mr. Johnson of using the migration crisis for domestic political ends.", "Mr. Darmanin, in a letter sent to Ms. Patel and that was seen by the Agence-France Presse, said he was \u201cdisappointed\u201d by the demands made in Mr. Johnson\u2019s letter and found it \u201ceven worse\u201d that he had made them public.", "Mr. Attal, the French government spokesman, told BFMTV that the publicly shared letter \u201cdid not match, at all, the exchanges that Boris Johnson had with the President over the phone as recently as Wednesday evening.\u201d", "Mr. Attal added that the suggestion France should take back migrants who reach British shores \u201cis obviously not what we need to fix the problem.\u201d Instead, he said, Britain should send its own immigration officials to France, where they would examine the claims of asylum seekers trying to reach British shores.", "Grant Shapps, the British Transport secretary, defended Mr. Johnson\u2019s letter, telling the BBC that \u201cfriends and neighbors\u201d had to work together and that he hoped France would reconsider disinviting Ms. Patel.", "\u201cIt\u2019s in our interests,\u201d he said. \u201cIt\u2019s in their interests. It\u2019s certainly in the interests of people who are being people-trafficked to the U.K, with these tragic scenes we\u2019re seeing.\u201d"]
